letter:
The position of speech organs for pronunciation of sound G isidentical with the position of speech organs for pronunciation of soundK. The difference is that vocal cords vibrate - the sound is voiced.Secondly, the period of occlusion is bit longer than with sound K, andall articulation organs are less tight. At the end, the root of thetongue strongly closes more space of the palate than with sound K.

Concentrates of acoustic energy:

  1. 200-400Hz
  2. 2100-2500Hz
  3. 3500-5000Hz
